biography.value:
Aaron Sims

Despite frequent shifts in leadership among other archdevils, Dispater has maintained his position as the ruler of Dis since its creation. Known for his vigilance and caution, he rarely leaves his tower, and even less frequently leaves the Iron City. Those who know his plans, including Asmodeus, know that he hopes to one day rule each layer of the Nine Hells.

Dispater remains one of the foremost suppliers of weapons across all the planes, which helps keep his position in Dis secure. As well, his advisors are carefully chosen and he maintains very few friendships.

Those that attempt battle with the Iron Lord find victory nigh impossible. In addition to his stratagem and defense, Dispater maintains extremely powerful abilities and a legion of minions. Outwitting him can't be done, and anyone unfortunate enough to catch him off guard is quickly disposed of.

Dispater remains calm and controlled in conversation. He prefers wherever possible to engage in gentlemanly debates rather than aggressive arguments. Unlike other archdevils, he almost never forces an individual into doing something, preferring to persuade or deceive instead. Fittingly, his skin is an iron-black color and his signature staff, wrought from the same iron as the tower he lives in, is always in hand.

Dispater's Lair p223[–]

The ruler of Dis makes his lair inside the Iron Tower. Within these confines he is vastly more protected.

Lair Actions[–]

On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Dispater can take one lair action to cause the following effect or one from the archdevil lair action list (page 214); he can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

  • Buckle. The area in a 120-foot-radius around Dispater bends and twists, becoming &Reference[rule=difficultterrain]{difficult terrain}. Dispater's Superheat Metal ability is recharged.

  • Attack. The archdevil uses one of their available melee or ranged attacks against a single foe.

  • Cast a Spell. The archdevil uses their Spellcasting feature to cast an available spell. If the spell normally requires @status[concentration], it lasts for the full duration instead.

  • Deceitful Whispers. The archdevil whispers to a creature they can see within 30 feet. The target must make a [[/save ability=wisdom dc=22]] saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the charmed condition until the start of their next turn and must use their reaction immediately to make an attack against one of the archdevil's enemies, chosen by the archdevil.

  • Fiendish Fortitude. The archdevil recharges one of their expended abilities.

  • Frenzy. The archdevil casts @spell[Haste] on themself. The effect ends at initiative count 20 of the next round.

  • Summon Underlings. The archdevil summons allied devils. The devils summoned depends on the archdevil using this feature. The summoned devils appear in unoccupied spaces which the archdevil can see. The @table[Archdevil Lair Action List; Summoned Underlings|CoA|Summoned Underlings] table shows which devils each archdevil can summon.

  • Teleport. The archdevil teleports themself to an area they can see within 120 feet.

  • Trap. The archdevil casts the @spell[Hold Monster] spell.

Regional Effects[–]

The region containing Dispater's lair is corrupted by his presence, which creates the following effect:

  • Din. Within 6 miles of the lair, the sound of metal working is near inescapable. Any creature attempting a short or long rest may do so, but must make a [[/save ability=constitution dc=21]] saving throw afterwards. Failure negates any benefits of the rest.

If Dispater dies, the effects fade over the course of [[/r 1d10]] days.

description.value: Dispater makes four attacks using his Wrought- Iron Tower, Iron Column, or a combination of the two. He can replace one of the attacks with Superheat Metal (if available).

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+20]]{+20} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 ([[/damage 2d8 + 12 type=bludgeoning]]) damage plus 7 ([[/damage 2d6 type=fire]]) damage. Dispater may replace the bludgeoning damage with damage of a type that the target is vulnerable to instead.

Ranged Spell Attack: [[/r 1d20+15]]{+15} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 21 ([[/damage 2d8 + 12 type=bludgeoning]]) damage plus 7 ([[/damage 2d6 type=fire]]) damage. Dispater may replace the bludgeoning damage with damage of a type that the target is vulnerable to instead.

Dispater targets a metal object he can see within 90 feet of him. The metal glows white-hot, burning all that touches it. If the object was held by a creature, the creature must succeed on a [[/save ability=dexterity dc=23]] saving throw to drop the object or take 45 ([[/damage 10d8 type=fire]]) damage. If the object is attached to a creature, or they couldn't feasibly drop it, they automatically fail the save. The object returns to room temperature at the end of Dispater's turn.

Dispater conjures a storm of iron nails and launches them forward in a 90-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line. All creatures within the line must make a [[/save ability=dexterity dc=23]] saving throw, taking 40 ([[/damage 16d4 type=piercing]]) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Nails launched from this ability stick into soft surfaces or fall to the ground after the attack finishes.
Magical darkness doesn't impede Dispater's darkvision.

When a creature starts their turn within 120 feet of Dispater, they must succeed on a [[/save ability=wisdom dc=22]] saving throw or have the &Reference[condition=frightened] condition until they leave the aura. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this effect for 1 hour.

Dispater regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes radiant damage this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Dispater dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and is unable to regenerate.
If Dispater fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

activation.condition: If Dispater fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

description.value: Dispater has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
Any nonmagical weapon or ammunition made of metal that hits Dispater corrodes. After its hit, the weapon or ammunition is destroyed.
Dispater makes a Wrought-Iron Tower attack.

Melee Spell Attack: [[/r 1d20+15]]{+15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 40 ([[/damage 6d10 + 7 type=force]]) damage, and the target must make a [[/save ability=constitution dc=23]] saving throw. On a failed save, the target's flesh begins to harden, and the creature's movement speed is halved for 1 minute. If the creature is harmed by Flesh to Iron again, while still partly iron, the rest of the creature also turns to iron, killing them.
Dispater summons an allied @creature[erinyes] in an unoccupied space that he can see.

Dispater can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Dispater regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

  • @UUID[Actor.iQaX6h91GbKHXRsv.Item.olCTSHCSaDnT93jj]{Staff}
  • @UUID[Actor.iQaX6h91GbKHXRsv.Item.s3hzxyG79sbPDbUD]{Flesh to Iron}
  • @UUID[Actor.iQaX6h91GbKHXRsv.Item.shUwkoLcir14C8IO]{Call Underling}
The area in a 120-foot-radius around Dispater bends and twists, becoming &Reference[rule=difficultterrain]{difficult terrain}. Dispater's Superheat Metal ability is recharged.
The archdevil uses one of their available melee or ranged attacks against a single foe.
The archdevil uses their Spellcasting feature to cast an available spell. If the spell normally requires @status[concentration], it lasts for the full duration instead.

The archdevil whispers to a creature they can see within 30 feet. The target must make a [[/save ability=wisdom dc=22]] saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the charmed condition until the start of their next turn and must use their reaction immediately to make an attack against one of the archdevil's enemies, chosen by the archdevil.
The archdevil recharges one of their expended abilities.
The archdevil casts @spell[Haste] on themself. The effect ends at initiative count 20 of the next round.

The archdevil summons allied devils. The devils summoned depends on the archdevil using this feature. The summoned devils appear in unoccupied spaces which the archdevil can see. The @table[Archdevil Lair Action List; Summoned Underlings|CoA|Summoned Underlings] table shows which devils each archdevil can summon.
The archdevil teleports themself to an area they can see within 120 feet.
The archdevil casts the @spell[Hold Monster] spell.

The region containing Dispater's lair is corrupted by his presence, which creates the following effect:

  • Din. Within 6 miles of the lair, the sound of metal working is near inescapable. Any creature attempting a short or long rest may do so, but must make a [[/save ability=constitution dc=21]] saving throw afterwards. Failure negates any benefits of the rest.

If Dispater dies, the effects fade over the course of [[/r 1d10]] days.
